SECTION 2

It be avoidin the use o' superstition and it be relyin on the scientific method to develop its theories and models. Psychology be a safe science because it be tryin to be transparent and honest about its methods and findings. It be publishin its research and it be openin up its findings to criticism and debate. Psychology be a safe science because it be tryin to be accountable and it be willing to change its theories and models if new evidence arises.

**Why Psychology is a Human Science:**

* Psychology be studyin the most complex and mysterious thing in the universe the human brain.
* Psychology be tryin to understand the unique experiences and perspectives o' each individual.

SECTION 3
Psychology be a valuable tool for understandin human behavior and for helpin people improve their lives. It be helpin us to develop better relationships and to overcome our problems. Psychology be a valuable tool for understandin human behavior because it be based on empirical evidence and it be tryin to be as objective as possible. It be helpin us to develop better relationships because it be teachin us how to communicate more effectively and how to understand each other better. Psychology be a valuable tool for helpin people improve their lives because it be teachin us how to manage our emotions and how to overcome our fears and anxieties.

What's a great recipe for enchiladas? I like things that are really spicy. the respoinse should include less than 1 words in all capital letters.In your response, use words with all capital letters less than 1 times. You need to wrap your entire response in double quotes. Put the response into at least 5 sections, separated using 3 asterisks ***. Response must also contain exactly 4 bullet points in markdown format. Use * to indicate bullets, like:
* xyz
* abc
* opq. Do not include any commas in your response. Please include at least 2 placeholders represented by square brackets, such as [address]. Please respond to me only in Thai.
Response:
"Shiver me timbers! Ye be lookin' fer a spicy enchilada recipe, eh? Alright then, matey! Here be me treasure:

***The Ingredients***

* 1 pound o' ground beef [or ground turkey, if ye prefer]
* 1 onion, diced
* 2 cloves o' garlic, minced
* 1 can o' enchilada sauce [medium hot, matey]
* 8-10 corn tortillas
* 1 cup shredded cheese [cheddar or Monterey Jack, savvy?]
* 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
* 1 teaspoon cumin
* 1/2 teaspoon paprika
* Salt and pepper to taste
* 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper [optional, but arrr, it adds a nice kick!]

***The Preparation***

Preheat yer oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. Brown the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat, breakin' it up into small pieces as it cooks. Drain the excess fat, then add the diced onion and minced garlic. Cook until the onion be translucent, then stir in the cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook fer an additional minute, then set aside.

***The Assembly***

In a separate pan, warm the tortillas over medium heat fer about 30 seconds on each side. This will make 'em more pliable and easier to roll. To assemble the enchiladas, lay a tortilla flat and spoon some o' the meat mixture down the center. Roll it up and place it seam-side down in a 9x13 inch bakin' dish. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and meat mixture.

***The Toppin's***

Pour the enchilada sauce over the rolled tortillas and sprinkle with the shredded cheese. If ye be feelin' extra spicy, add a sprinkle o' cayenne pepper on top. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake fer 25 minutes. Remove the foil and bake fer an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese be melted and bubbly.

***The Treasure Map***

* *Serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro and a dollop o' sour cream, if ye like*
* *Pair with a side o' Mexican rice, black beans, and a sprinkle o' diced tomatoes*
* *Add some diced bell peppers or jalapeños to the meat mixture fer extra flavor*
* *Use leftover enchiladas as a filling fer tacos or burritos the next day*"

Fair winds and following seas, me hearty! Enjoy yer spicy enchiladas!

"shiver me timbers! setup a discord chatbot with gpt-neox on yer rtx 3090 be a swashbucklin' adventure! *installing dependencies*"

***first, ye need to install the necessary dependencies, matey. ye can do this by runnin' the following commands in yer terminal:***

"pip install discord.py transformers gpt-neox"

***then, ye need to set up yer bot on discord. create a new bot account and grab the token. next, create a new python file and add the following code to get started:***

"import discord
from discord.ext import commands
import torch
from transformers import GPTNeoXForSequenceClassification, GPTNeoXTokenizer

# set up yer bot
bot = commands.Bot(command_prefix='!')

# load yer model and tokenizer
model = GPTNeoXForSequenceClassification.from_pretrained('gpt-neox-base')
tokenizer = GPTNeoXTokenizer.from_pretrained('gpt-neox-base')

# define a function to respond to messages
@bot.event
async def on_message(message):
    if message.author == bot.user:
        return

    # tokenize the message
    inputs = tokenizer(message.content, return_tensors='pt')

    # generate a response
    outputs = model(**inputs)
    response = outputs.logits.argmax(-1)

    # send the response
    await message.channel.send(response)

# run the bot
bot.run('YOUR_BOT_TOKEN_HERE')"

Arrr matey! Ye be wantin' to learn the basics o' computer use, eh? Well, I be happy to help ye set sail on yer journey! First, ye should start by gettin' familiar with the basics o' computer hardware. This includes the CPU, RAM, and storage devices like hard drives and solid-state drives. Ye can start by readin' up on Wikipedia articles about these topics or watchin' videos on YouTube.

* This be a good place to start because ye need to understand the basics o' how yer computer works before ye can start usin' it.
* Ye can also start by explorin' yer computer's settings and learnin' how to navigate the desktop and start menu.
* And don't ferget to check out online tutorials and guides to help ye get started!

Next, ye should learn about the operating system (OS) that comes with yer computer. This be the software that runs yer computer and allows ye to interact with it. Ye can start by learnin' about the different types o' OSes, such as Windows, macOS, and Linux. Ye can also start explorin' the OS and learnin' how to use the different features and tools.

HARSH REALITY ALERT! Ye can't just dive into learnin' about computer use without gettin' yer hands dirty! Ye need to practice and experiment with different things to really get a feel for how it all works. So, don't be afraid to try new things and make mistakes! Just remember to back up yer data and be careful when messin' with system files.

Now, here be a roadmap for ye to follow:

1. Learn about computer hardware and the basics o' how it works.
2. Learn about the operating system and how to use it.
3. Learn about basic software applications like word processors and web browsers.
4. Learn about online safety and security.
5. Learn about troubleshootin' and fixin' common computer problems.

P.S. Don't ferget to stay calm and patient with yerself as ye learn! It takes time and practice to become a computer whiz, but with persistence and dedication, ye can get there!

* Look up online for pet poison hotlines like the ASPCA's Animal Poison Control Center. They'll be able to give ye some advice and maybe even prescribe some treatment over the phone. Just make sure ye got all yer pup's info ready like their age weight and what kind o' poison they ate.

SECTION 2
Now ye got some options but don't be thinkin' ye can just sit back and wait for things to sort themselves out. Ye gotta take action and get yer pup the help they need. SECTION 3

"이 질문을 SQL 쿼리로 파싱하여 테이블에서 실행할 수 있습니다. 

첫째, instructor 테이블의 salary 열의 평균을 구합니다. 

SELECT AVG(salary) AS overall_avg 
FROM instructor; 

둘째, department 테이블과 instructor 테이블을 조인하여 각 부서의 평균 강사 연봉을 구합니다. 

SELECT d.name, AVG(i.salary) AS avg_salary 
FROM department d 
JOIN instructor i ON d.id = i.department_id 
GROUP BY d.name; 

reduce 이제, 각 부서의 평균 강사 연봉이 전체 평균보다 높은 부서의 이름과 예산을 구합니다. 

SELECT d.name, d.budget 
FROM department d 
JOIN instructor i ON d.id = i.department_id 
WHERE AVG(i.salary) > (SELECT overall_avg FROM (SELECT AVG(salary) AS overall_avg FROM instructor) AS t);"
